chess.pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlackPiece, WhitePiece

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Our piece abstract class. It provides a model/frame for all chess pieces.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Piece() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void calculatePossibleMoves()
      An abstract method that calculates all possible moves (excluding takes) of a piece.
      abstract void calculatePossibleTakes()
      An abstract method that calculates all possible spots at which this piece can take another piece.
      boolean canMove(int i, int j)
      Determines whether or not this piece can move to a desired spot on the chess board.
      boolean canTake(int i, int j)
      Determines whether or not this piece can take a piece at a desired spot on the chess board.
      void clearPossibleMoves()
      Clears the possibleMoves ArrayList.
      void clearPossibleTakes()
      Clears the possibleTakes ArrayList.
      int getCol()
      Returns the column index of this piece.
      java.util.ArrayList<Point> getPossibleMoves()
      Returns the possibleMoves ArrayList.
      java.util.ArrayList<Point> getPossibleTakes()
      Returns the possibleTakes ArrayList.

      Returns the row index of this piece.

        public Piece()

    • Method Detail

      • calculatePossibleMoves

        public abstract void calculatePossibleMoves()
        An abstract method that calculates all possible moves (excluding takes) of a piece. It populates the possibleMoves ArrayList.

      • calculatePossibleTakes

        public abstract void calculatePossibleTakes()
        An abstract method that calculates all possible spots at which this piece can take another piece. It populates the possibleTakes ArrayList.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int i,
                       int j)
        Determines whether or not this piece can move to a desired spot on the chess board.
        Parameters:
        i - the desired row index
        j - the desired column index
        Returns:
        true if this piece can move to the spot, false otherwise

      • canTake

        public boolean canTake(int i,
                       int j)
        Determines whether or not this piece can take a piece at a desired spot on the chess board.
        Parameters:
        i - the desired row index
        j - the desired column index
        Returns:
        true if this piece can take at the spot, false otherwise

      • getPossibleMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Point> getPossibleMoves()
        Returns the possibleMoves ArrayList.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing Point objects

      • getPossibleTakes

        public java.util.ArrayList<Point> getPossibleTakes()
        Returns the possibleTakes ArrayList.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing Point objects

      • clearPossibleMoves

        public void clearPossibleMoves()
        Clears the possibleMoves ArrayList.

      • clearPossibleTakes

        public void clearPossibleTakes()
        Clears the possibleTakes ArrayList.

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        Returns the row index of this piece.
        Returns:
        an int representing the row index

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        Returns the column index of this piece.
        Returns:
        an int representing the column index

      • setPos

        public void setPos(int row,
                   int col)
        Changes the row and col fields of this piece.
        Parameters:
        row - the desired row index
        col - the desired column index
